abstract: In a deal aimed at rivaling Apple’s iTunes and Nokia’s Ovi, Sony Ericsson will offer more than five million music tracks on it PlayNow Internet and mobile phone service.
snippet: In a deal aimed at rivaling Apple’s iTunes and Nokia’s Ovi, Sony Ericsson will offer more than five million music tracks on it PlayNow Internet and mobile phone service.
lead_paragraph: LONDON (Dow Jones)  Sony Ericsson announced content deals on Sunday with three of the world’s four top music labels, ahead of the introduction of its online music store in May.

headline.main: Sony Ericsson Sets Deals With 3 Labels
headline.print_headline: Sony Ericsson Sets Deals With 3 Labels

abstract: David K. P. Li, a former board member of Dow Jones & Company, has reached a tentative agreement with federal securities regulators to pay more than $8 million to settle allegations of insider trading during last year’s takeover battle for the media group, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: David K. P. Li, a former board member of Dow Jones & Company, has reached a tentative agreement with federal securities regulators to pay more than $8 million to settle allegations of insider trading during last year’s takeover battle for the media group, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Ex-Dow Jones Director Said to Settle With S.E.C.

abstract: Under the stewardship of Dow Kim and Thomas G. Maheras, Merrill Lynch and Citigroup built positions in subprime-related securities that led to $34 billion in write-downs last year. The debacle cost chief executives their jobs and brought two of the world’s premier financial institutions to their knees.
lead_paragraph: Under the stewardship of Dow Kim and Thomas G. Maheras, Merrill Lynch and Citigroup built positions in subprime-related securities that led to $34 billion in write-downs last year. The debacle cost chief executives their jobs and brought two of the world’s premier financial institutions to their knees.
